metadata.name: Dump Credentials from Windows Credential Manager With PowerShell
metadata.comment: Adversaries may search for common password storage locations to obtain user credentials. Passwords are stored in several places on a system, depending on the operating system or application holding the credentials.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM script_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND (contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('get-passwordvaultcredentials')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('get-credmancreds')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('new-object')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('windows.security.credentials.passwordvault')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('new-object')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('microsoft.csharp.csharpcodeprovider')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('[system.runtime.interopservices.runtimeenvironment]::getruntimedirectory())')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('collections.arraylist')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('system.codedom.compiler.compilerparameters'))))

output.summary: Adversaries may search for common password storage locations to obtain user credentials. Passwords are stored in several places on a system, depending on the operating system or application holding the credentials.
